column1: Rome Army Ability - Reinforcement - You may spend a Command Action and mark a Reinforcement Box on a unit in order to heal a point of damage on that unit or on a unit it is backing up, provided the backed-up unit has a Reinforcement box. Replacement - You may spend one command action to have an unengaged backup unit trade places with a unit it is backing up, provideed that both units have Reinforcement boxes. The first unit becomes engaged with whatever unit(s) the other unit was engaged with and is considered charging; the enemy unit(s) are not considered charging.
(2 Reinforcement Boxes) Courage +1 if backed up. Range attack uses the Pila rule.
(2 Reinforcement Boxes) Courage +1 if backed up. ?(-1) -0/-0 when charging. ?(+0) +1/+0 vs. cavalry or large units. ?(+0) +0/+2 when holding vs. charging cavalry or large.
(2 Reinforcement Boxes) Courage +1 if backed up. Range attack uses the Pila rule.

Backs up any unit whose rear center point is closer than its front center point and within 5" of Triarii front center point. Units backed up by at least one Triarii get ?(+1) +0/+0 unless charging.
Skirmisher. Ranged attack uses the Javelin rule. ?+2/+0 vs. ranged attacks.
